de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.functional

Class Functional

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.functional.Functional

  • public abstract class Functional
extends java.lang.Object
    Common interfaces for functional style.
    Author:
    Marcus Pinnecke

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Functional.IBinaryFunction<T,U,R>
      Represents a function that takes two arguments of type T and U.
      static interface  Functional.IConsumer<T>
      Represents an operation that takes one arguments of type T and produces no result.
      static class  Functional.IdentityFunction<T>
      Represents a function that takes one arguments of type T and returns a result of the same type.
      static interface  Functional.IFunction<T,R>
      Represents a function that takes one argument of type T and returns a result of type R.
      static interface  Functional.IProvider<T>
      Represents an operation that takes no arguments but produces a result of type T.
      static class  Functional.NullConsumer<T> 
      static class  Functional.NullFunction<T,U>
      Returns null independent of the input argument.
      static class  Functional.ToCharSequenceFunction<T>
      Convenience function to invoke Object.toString() on the input parameter.
      static class  Functional.ToStringFunction<T>
      Convenience function to invoke Object.toString() on the input parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public static <U,T extends U> java.lang.Iterable<T> filter(java.lang.Iterable<T> source,
                                                           IFilter<U> predicate)
        Filters an object named source that yields elements of type T by a given predicate over U and transforms all qualified elements from T to U using a user-defined Filter. This filtering is done in a lazy manner using iterator logic. Furthermore, it is guaranteed not to remove any element from the iterator i.

        It is assumed that source and predicate are non-null.

        This is a non-blocking operation.
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        T -
        Parameters:
        source - Source of elements
        predicate - Filter condition
        Returns:
        An iterable object that yields all qualified elements of source
        Since:
        3.0

                                                           java.util.List<IFilter<U>> predicate)

      • map

        public static <U,T> java.lang.Iterable<U> map(java.lang.Iterable<T> source,
                                              Functional.IFunction<T,U> function)
        Maps a user-defined Functional.IFunction that takes elements of type T and returns for each element a result of type U on each element of an object named source that yields elements of type T. This mapping process is done in a lazy manner using iterator logic. Furthermore, it is guaranteed not to remove any element from the iterator i.

        It is assumed that source and function are non-null.

        This is a non-blocking operation.
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        T -
        Parameters:
        source - Source of elements
        function - user-defined Functional.IFunction
        Returns:
        An iterable object that yields all elements of source after applying function
        Since:
        3.0

      • mapToString

        Converts the iterator of type T into an iterator of type String by invoking toString() on each element.
        It is guaranteed to not remove any element from the iterator.

        This is a non-blocking operation.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        source - Source of elements
        Returns:
        An iterable object that yields all elements of source after invoking toString on them
        Since:
        3.0

      • toList

        public static <T> java.util.List<T> toList(java.lang.Iterable<T> source)
        Converts the iterator i of type T into a list of type T by adding each element of i to the result list.

        It is guaranteed not to remove any element from the iterator.

        This is a blocking operation. The resulting list is not modifiable
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        source - Source of elements
        Returns:
        A list of object that were yielded by source
        Since:
        3.0

      • mapToCharSequenceList

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<java.lang.CharSequence> mapToCharSequenceList(java.lang.Iterable<T> source)
        Converts the iterator source of type T into a collection of CharSequence using a binary function invoking Object.toString() on each element in source and finally toList(Iterable) on the result.

        It is guaranteed not to remove any element from the iterator.

        This is a blocking operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        source - Source of elements
        Returns:
        A collection of CharSequence that were yielded by source
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        Functional.ToCharSequenceFunction

      • toIterator

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> toIterator(java.util.Enumeration<T> enumeration)
        Converts the enumeration enumeration of type T into an Iterable of T. The enumeration is read into a intermediate collection which is then used to create the result value.
        It is guaranteed not to remove any element from the iterator.

        This is a blocking operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T -
        Parameters:
        enumeration - Enumeration of elements
        Returns:
        An iterable of T that were yielded by enumeration
        Since:
        3.0

      • join

        public static <T,R> R join(java.lang.Iterable<T> source,
                           R delimiter,
                           Functional.IProvider<R> newInstanceOfR,
                           Functional.IFunction<T,R> convert,
                           Functional.IBinaryFunction<R,R,R> concat)
        Joins the elements of type T in source using delimiter as the delimiting element between a pair of elements from source into a combined object of type R. The method first constructs a new instance of R as the result using the newInstanceOfR parameter. Afterwards source is converted to a list of type T. For each element in this list the function parameter concat is invoked with result as the first parameter and the current element of the list as second parameter. For each pair of elements, concat is invoked again to add the delimiter.

        Example
        The convenience method join(Iterable, String, IFunction) which takes the elements yielded by source and joins these elements into a string is implemented using the general method join(Iterable, Object, IProvider, IFunction, IBinaryFunction):. <T> String join(Iterable<T> source, String delimiter, IFunction<T, String> convert) { return join(source, delimiter, new IProvider<String>() { String invoke() { return ""; } }, convert, new IBinaryFunction<String, String, String>() { String invoke(String t, String u) { return t + u; } }); }
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements whose iterable source should be joined to an object of type R
        R - The targeted type of the joined elements of source
        Parameters:
        source - The input source of elements from type T
        delimiter - delimiter The delimiting element between elements of source, after each element of source was converted to type R
        newInstanceOfR - Constructs a new instance of type R each time it is invoked
        convert - A function which converts an object of type T to type R
        concat - A binary function which takes two objects of type T and concats them to a single object using the delimiter delimiter.
        Returns:
        Joined version of source using delimiter
        Since:
        3.0

      • join

        public static <T> java.lang.String join(java.lang.Iterable<T> source,
                                        java.lang.String delimiter,
                                        Functional.IFunction<T,java.lang.String> convert)
        Takes the elements yielded by source and joins these elements into a string. The parameter delimiter is the delimiting element between two elements in the string. Since source is a iterable over a arbitrary type T, the parameter convert of type IFunction deals with the converting from T to String.

        Example
        In the following example, the list of double values {7.7534, 2.322, 14.532} is joined using join(Iterable, String, IFunction). Each value is rounded to one decimal place. The entire rounded values are then joined using a whitespace. The result 7,8 2,4 14,6 is printed to standard out. final DecimalFormat df = new DecimalFormat("#.#"); df.setRoundingMode(RoundingMode.CEILING); IFunction<Double, String> roundDoubleToString = new IFunction<Double, String>() { @Override public String invoke(Double input) { return df.format(input.doubleValue()).toString(); } }; List<Double> list = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(new Double[] {7.7534, 2.322, 14.532})); String joinedValues = Functional.join(list, " ", roundDoubleToString); System.out.println(joinedValues); It is good practise to store multiple occurrences of the function convert into a static member of some class. The example above can be than reduced to the following.

        List<Double> list = new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(new Double[] {7.7534, 2.322, 14.532})); String joinedValues = Functional.join(list, " ", ROUND_DOUBLE_TO_STRING); System.out.println(joinedValues);
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the elements in source
        Parameters:
        source - The input source of elements from type T
        delimiter - The delimiting string between elements of source
        convert - A function to convert from T to String
        Returns:
        A string representation of the joined elements of source using delimited as delimiting string
        Since:
        3.0
        See Also:
        join(Iterable, Object, IProvider, IFunction, IBinaryFunction)

      • equals

        public static <T,U> boolean equals(java.lang.Iterable<T> lhs,
                                   java.lang.Iterable<T> rhs,
                                   Functional.IFunction<T,U> map)
        Checks if the two given iterables lhs and rhs are equal. Moreover, the elements from both iterables are converted from origin type T to target type U using the parameter map. The methods maps map on both lhs and rhs in order to produce a Set of type U for both. Both sets are than compared using Set.equals(Object).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the elements of both iterables lhs and rhs
        U - an intermediate type to check the equality.
        Parameters:
        lhs - Iterable which should be checked of equality to rhs
        rhs - Iterable which should be checked of equality to lhs
        map - Converts elements from T to U
        Returns:
        true if the elements in lhs are also in rhs and vice versa, otherwise false.
        Note on duplicates: Duplicates in both lhs and rhs are eliminated before the test of equality.
        Since:
        3.0

      • getEmptyIterable

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> getEmptyIterable(java.lang.Class<? extends T> className)
        Returns an type-safe empty iterable of type T as convenience counterpart to Collections.emptyIterator() or Collections.emptyList().

        The parameter className is required to infer the type of T at compile time.

        Example The following example shows how to create an empty iterable of type IFeature. Iterable<IFeature> it = Functional.getEmptyIterable(IFeature.class));
        Type Parameters:
        T - the infered type of the iterable, must be compatible to className
        Parameters:
        className - the class name of the type T
        Returns:
        Returns an empty type-safe iterable of type T
        Since:
        3.0

      • isEmpty

        public static <T> boolean isEmpty(java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable)
        Checks whenever iterable is empty or not by calling iterable.iterator().hasNext()
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of elements in iterable
        Parameters:
        iterable - iterable collection of type T
        Returns:
        true if iterable is empty, otherwise false
        Since:
        3.0
